Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with a rounded body, set off from the flat top by a double groove, a bottle-like filling neck with a groove round the top, and a short tapering flat-topped nozzle with a rounded end. The ring-base is convex within. The upper surface is polished or self-slipped. Fine orange fabric with very fine mica and white inclusions <0.5mm.
Curator's comments: Bailey dates this based on its similarity to other Egyptian types, though does not exclude the posibility that it could be late Roman (Bailey 1977, 252).
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q539)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (242)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.040) (Phase 1)
